column4: i just checked my logs and over the last few days theres thousands of attempts
PXE sounds like a network boot loader issue
is there one that will tell me when new attempts start from a new IP?
cause out of the thousand there were only 5 IPs
chinese, indian, italian, US and unknown..
like i have root login disabled and there were a ton of failed root logins
i wonder if the people are coming from IRC?
or just random
i heard there was a massive security flaw with ssl a few months back
ssh
that's  already been repaired hasn'
so they say, but the keys you generated during that period are still vulnerable
that sounds like the DNS thing that was going on too
what DNS thing?
dns only lets you generate so many numbers if you do something sorta like a DDOS then you cna trick servers into reusing old keys or something like that, CNET's BOL did a big podcast on it
exactly
did you see my explanation on the whole DNS thing?
ya but i dont really understand
i'll see if i can find the podcast link
cool
here's the link, http://www.cnet.com/8301-11455_1-10010246-10.html
you sure? i dont see any mention of dns
it says "Blackhat 2008: dns flaw something previoulsy reported"
thx
